intro: Cyanea nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. Cyanea nelsonii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
